pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:0.4.eng: The training rule on those who conceal offenses

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sundarīnandā bhikkhunī sāḷhena migāranattunā gabbhinī hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Sundarīnandā was pregnant by Migāra’s grandson Sāḷha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.3.pli: Yāva gabbho taruṇo ahosi tāva chādesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.3.eng: When the fetus got large, she concealed her condition.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.4.eng: And when the fetus was fully grown, she disrobed and gave birth.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.5.eng: The nuns said to the nun Thullanandā,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.6.eng: “Venerable, Sundarīnandā gave birth shortly after disrobing.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.7.pli: Kacci no sā bhikkhunīyeva samānā gabbhinī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.7.eng: “Could it be that she was pregnant while she was still a nun?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.9.pli: “Kissa pana tvaṃ, ayye, jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodesi na gaṇassa ārocesī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.9.eng: “But, Venerable, when you knew that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, why didn’t you either confront her yourself or tell the community?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.9.comm: “Confront” renders paṭicodesi. For a discussion of the closely related term codeti, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.10.pli: “Yo etissā avaṇṇo mayheso avaṇṇo, yā etissā akitti mayhesā akitti, yo etissā ayaso mayheso ayaso, yo etissā alābho mayheso alābho.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.10.eng: “Her disrepute is my disrepute, her infamy is my infamy, her notoriety is my notoriety, her loss is my loss.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.11.pli: Kyāhaṃ, ayye, attano avaṇṇaṃ attano akittiṃ attano ayasaṃ attano alābhaṃ paresaṃ ārocessāmī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.11.eng: Why would I tell others of my own disrepute, infamy, notoriety, and loss?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.12.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.12.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodessati na gaṇassa ārocessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.13.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confront her herself nor tell the community?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.14.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.14.eng: Then those nuns told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.15.eng: and the monks in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.16.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.16.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodeti na gaṇassa ārocetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.17.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā acted like this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodessati na gaṇassa ārocessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.20.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confront her herself nor tell the community?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.22.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.23.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodeyya na gaṇassa āroceyya, yadā ca sā ṭhitā vā assa cutā vā nāsitā vā avassaṭā vā, sā pacchā evaṃ vadeyya—‘pubbevāhaṃ, ayye, aññāsiṃ etaṃ bhikkhuniṃ evarūpā ca evarūpā ca sā bhaginīti, no ca kho attanā paṭicodessaṃ na gaṇassa ārocessan’ti, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā vajjappaṭicchādikā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.23.1.eng: ‘If a nun knows that a nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but she neither confronts her herself nor tells the community, and afterward—whether that nun remains or has died or has been expelled or has converted—she says, “Venerables, although I previously knew that this nun was like this, I thought, ‘I will neither confront her myself nor tell the community,’” she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on those who conceal offenses.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassā ārocenti, sā vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.6.eng: she knows by herself or others have told her or she has told her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.6.comm: “She has told her” presumably means that the nun who has committed the offense has spoken about it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.7.eng: Has committed an offense entailing expulsion:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.8.eng: she has committed any one of the eight offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.10.eng: she does not herself accuse her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.12.eng: she does not tell other nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.13.pli: Yadā ca sā ṭhitā vā assa cutā vāti
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.13.eng: Whether that nun remains or has died:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.14.eng: Remains: what is meant is that she remains as a nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.14.comm: Vin-vn-ṭ 1989: Saliṅge tu ṭhitāyāti pabbajjāliṅgeyeva ṭhitāya, “For one remaining in the characteristic means: for one remaining in the characteristic of being gone forth.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.15.eng: Has died: what is meant is that she has passed away.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.17.pli: sayaṃ vā vibbhantā hoti aññehi vā nāsitā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.17.eng: she has either disrobed herself or been expelled by others.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.17.comm: “Disrobed” renders vibbhantā. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.19.eng: what is meant is that she has joined another religious community.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.20.pli: Sā pacchā evaṃ vadeyya— “pubbevāhaṃ, ayye, aññāsiṃ etaṃ bhikkhuniṃ evarūpā ca evarūpā ca sā bhaginī”ti. No ca kho attanā paṭicodessanti
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.20.eng: Afterward she says, “Venerables, although I previously knew that this nun was like this, I thought, ‘I will neither confront her myself’”:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.25.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.27.pli: seyyathāpi nāma paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pamutto abhabbo haritatthāya, evameva bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodessāmi na gaṇassa ārocessāmīti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte assamaṇī hoti asakyadhītā. Tena vuccati pārājikā hotīti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.27.eng: just as a fallen, withered leaf is incapable of becoming green again, so is a nun who knows that a nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but who thinks, “I will neither confront her myself nor tell the community,” by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, not a monastic, not a daughter of the Sakyan. Therefore it is said “she is expelled.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.29.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā. Eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.29.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.30.pli: So tāya saddhiṃ natthi. Tena vuccati asaṃvāsāti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.30.eng: She does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.2.pli: “saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ vā kalaho vā viggaho vā vivādo vā bhavissatī”ti nāroceti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.2.eng: if she does not tell because she thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.3.eng: if she does not tell because she thinks there will be a schism or fracture in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.4.pli: “ayaṃ kakkhaḷā pharusā jīvitantarāyaṃ vā brahmacariyantarāyaṃ vā karissatī”ti nāroceti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.4.eng: if she does not tell because she thinks the person she is telling about is cruel and harsh and that she might become a threat to life or the monastic life;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.5.eng: if she does not tell because she does not see any suitable nuns;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.6.eng: if she does not tell, but not because she wants to conceal;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.7.eng: if she does not tell because she thinks the other person will be known through her own actions;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.10.eng: if she is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.11.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.12.eng: The sixth offense entailing expulsion is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:0.4.eng: The training rule on taking sides with one who has been ejected

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ anuvattati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.2.eng: the nun Thullanandā was taking sides with the monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ anuvattissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.4.eng: “How can Venerable Thullanandā take sides with the monk Ariṭṭha who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ anuvattatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā is doing this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ anuvattissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.8.eng: “How can the nun Thullanandā take sides with the monk Ariṭṭha who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaraṃ appaṭikāraṃ akatasahāyaṃ tamanuvatteyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi evamassa vacanīyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun takes sides with a monk who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha—in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—and who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends, the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.12.pli: ‘eso kho, ayye, bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ukkhitto dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaro appaṭikāro akatasahāyo, māyye, etaṃ bhikkhuṃ anuvattī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.12.eng: “Venerable, this monk has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction. He’s disrespectful, hasn’t made amends, and hasn’t made friends. Venerable, don’t take sides with this monk.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.13.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.13.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.14.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.14.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.15.pli: No ce paṭinissajjeyya, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā ukkhittānuvattikā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:1.15.eng: If she does not stop, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on taking sides with one who has been ejected.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.6.eng: those belonging to the same Buddhist sect and staying within the same monastery zone.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.6.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “monastery zone” for sīmā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.8.pli: āpattiyā adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā ukkhitto.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.8.eng: who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends, or for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.9.eng: In accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.10.eng: in accordance with that Teaching, in accordance with that Monastic Law.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.10.comm: Sp 2.669: Dhammenāti bhūtena vatthunā. Vinayenāti codetvā sāretvā. Padabhājanaṁ panassa “yena dhammena yena vinayena ukkhitto suukkhitto hotī”ti imaṁadhippāyamattaṁ dassetuṁ vuttaṁ, “Dhammena: according to truth, according to the rule. Vinayena: having accused, having reminded. But the word analysis is spoken to show just this meaning: ‘Yena dhammena yena vinayena means ejected, properly ejected.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.11.eng: In accordance with the Teacher’s instruction:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.12.eng: in accordance with the Victor’s instruction, in accordance with the Buddha’s instruction.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.14.pli: saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā puggalaṃ vā kammaṃ vā nādiyati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.14.eng: he does not heed the Sangha, groups of monks, individual monks, or legal procedures.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.16.eng: he has been ejected and not readmitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.18.eng: monks belonging to the same Buddhist sect is what is meant by “friends”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.19.pli: So tehi saddhiṃ natthi, tena vuccati akatasahāyoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.19.eng: He is not together with them—therefore it is called “who has not made friends”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.21.pli: yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti yaṅkhantiko yaṃruciko, sāpi taṃdiṭṭhikā hoti taṅkhantikā taṃrucikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.21.eng: she has the same view, the same belief, the same persuasion as he does.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.23.eng: that nun who supports one who has been ejected.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.25.pli: aññāhi bhikkhunīhi. Yā passanti yā suṇanti tāhi vattabbā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.25.eng: other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.26.pli: “eso kho, ayye, bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ukkhitto dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaro appaṭikāro akatasahāyo.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.26.eng: “Venerable, this monk has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction. He’s disrespectful, hasn’t made amends, and hasn’t made friends.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.27.eng: Venerable, don’t take sides with this monk.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.28.eng: And they should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.30.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.31.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.32.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.33.eng: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the midst of the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.34.pli: “eso kho, ayye, bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena ukkhitto dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaro appaṭikāro akatasahāyo.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.34.eng: “Venerable, this monk has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction. He’s disrespectful, hasn’t made amends, and hasn’t made friends.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.35.eng: Venerable, don’t take sides with this monk.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.36.eng: They should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.38.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.39.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.41.eng: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.42.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.43.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.44.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaraṃ appaṭikāraṃ akatasahāyaṃ tamanuvattati, sā taṃ vatthuṃ na paṭinissajjati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.44.eng: The nun so-and-so is taking sides with a monk who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha—in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—and who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends. And she keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.45.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.45.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.47.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.48.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anādaraṃ appaṭikāraṃ akatasahāyaṃ tamanuvattati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.48.eng: The nun so-and-so is taking sides with a monk who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha—in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—and who is disrespectful, who has not made amends, and who has not made friends.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.49.eng: And she keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.50.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.50.eng: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.51.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.51.eng: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.52.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.53.eng: For the second time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.54.eng: For the third time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.55.pli: Samanubhaṭṭhā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.55.eng: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.56.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.56.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.57.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.57.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.58.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.59.eng: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.61.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.63.pli: seyyathāpi nāma puthusilā dvedhā bhinnā appaṭisandhikā hoti, evameva bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī assamaṇī hoti asakyadhītā. Tena vuccati pārājikā hotīti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.63.eng: just as an ordinary stone that has broken in half cannot be put together again, so is a nun who does not stop when pressed three times not a monastic, not a daughter of the Sakyan. Therefore it is said “she is expelled.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.65.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā. Eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.65.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.66.pli: So tāya saddhiṃ natthi. Tena vuccati asaṃvāsāti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.1.66.eng: She does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, but she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematikā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.3.2.eng: if she has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.3.6.eng: if she is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.3.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj7:2.3.8.eng: The seventh offense entailing expulsion is finished.
